address: Phường Bình Trị Đông B, Quận Bình Tân, Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh
thought:
**Determining the New Administrative Unit for "Phường Bình Trị Đông B"**

Okay, so I've got an old address, "Phường Bình Trị Đông B", in "Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh", and I need to figure out its new administrative unit. My process is pretty straightforward, leveraging my knowledge of these kinds of situations.

First, I need to understand if any province-level changes happened. I'll check Resolution 60-NQ/TW to see if "Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh" was affected. Hmm, no province-level mergers are indicated here. However, it *does* note that "Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh" keeps the same name after any potential future mergers – useful for my output!

Next, I'll dive into the other resolutions, specifically 1685/NQ-UBTVQH15, to see if there's any mention of "Phường Bình Trị Đông B". Bingo! Line 37 is a key one: it explicitly states that "Phường Bình Trị Đông B", along with "An Lạc A" and "An Lạc", are merged into a *new* ward called "Phường An Lạc".

Now, I'll need to cross-reference this information with my "New wards" data. I'll search for "Phường An Lạc" within "Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh". Perfect! I've found an entry: `{"ward_code":"27460","ward_name":"Phường An Lạc","province_name":"Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh"}`.

Putting it all together, I can confidently construct the output. My `confidence` is "high" because the resolution explicitly outlined the merger and I found a corresponding new ward. My `province_name` is "Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh", confirmed by the province-level resolution and the new ward data. I have the `ward_code` and `ward_name` from the data on the new wards. The `citation` will be based on the matching resolution details. Looks like I've successfully mapped the old ward to the new one!

citation.header: 1685/NQ-UBTVQH15: Sắp xếp các đơn vị hành chính cấp xã của Thành phố Hồ Chí Minh
citation.line: 37. Sắp xếp toàn bộ diện tích tự nhiên, quy mô dân số của các phường Bình Trị Đông B, An Lạc A và An Lạc thành phường mới có tên gọi là phường An Lạc.
